text:
Hey, baby.
How was school?

Can't talk.
Got to study.

Got to study?
What happened?

- Nothing happened, Ma.
- Nuh-uh.

See, the last time you said
nothing happened like that,

we had to wait six months for
Chelsea's eyebrows to grow back.
What happened?

It's just that when you
embarrassed Mr. Petracelli--

He came for you,
didn't he? Ooh!

I knew something
was going to happen.

Okay, you know what?
This stops now, all right?

Here's what we're going to do.
We're going to set up a sting.

You're going to wear a wire
and I'm gonna swoop in

and I'm gonna
catch him in the act.
Or we can do nothing.

Uh, excuse me, have we met?
What do you mean do nothing?

I mean, I want to earn
a good grade on my own

to show him
he's wrong about me.

He said that I'm going
to fail his class,

but I'm going
to prove him wrong.

I think you mean
we're going to prove him wrong.

- I meant me.
- I heard "we."

- I said "me."
- Yeah, "we."
Me!
We.

Done. I finally finished
studying for my history test.

Not you're not.
Read these books.

European history,
African history,

and the complete history
of sports

just in case he throws you
a curveball.

- ( powering off )
- Who was the de facto leader
of the French Republic?
Uh-- uh, Napoleon?

- Napoleon who?
- Bonaparte?

Yeah. There you go, Booker.
You got to be thorough.

Petracelli takes no prisoners,
like that Napoleon...
what's his name.

Who was the 16th president
of the United States?
Come on, Mom. I'm tired.
You know who doesn't get tired?

Mr. Petracelli
and Abraham Lincoln.

What does Lincoln have
to do with this?

He's the 16th president
of the United States.
Who said "I cannot tell a lie?"
George Washington.

Oh, that's my baby.
That's my baby.

Sweet dreams of taking
Petracelli down.
